synopsis.text:
Koji Morimoto, a renowned animator and collaborator with Studio 4Â°C, joined forces with techno artist Ken Ishii to create a groundbreaking short anime clip titled 'EXTRA' in 1 the year 1995. This innovative collaboration marked their first venture into blending techno music with animation, resulting in a visually stunning and thought-provoking piece that left viewers questioning the meaning behind the title.

Set in a dystopian city, 'EXTRA' thrusts viewers into a chaotic and violent world of virtual reality. The story follows a man who assumes various forms, including a young boy armed with a pistol, as he navigates the grotesque landscape on a tricycle. The animation masterfully showcases Morimoto's signature style, featuring a diverse cast of characters such as robots, astronauts, and slick badasses, all clashing in a frantic and bloody game of survival.

The unique blend of Morimoto's striking visuals and Ishii's pulsating techno beats earned 'EXTRA' widespread acclaim, both domestically and internationally. The clip was voted as the "MTV Dance Video of the Year" in England, further fueling the growing popularity of Japanimation.

In summary, 'EXTRA' is a masterful fusion of techno music and animation that captivates viewers with its intense visuals and intriguing narrative. The collaboration between Morimoto and Ishii resulted in a groundbreaking piece that left a lasting impact on the world of animation.
